<span>

But Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/09/coronavirus-stimulus-mitch-mcconnell-says-relief-deal-unlikely-soon.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shot down hopes</a></span><span> that Congress might squeeze a relief package through before Election Day.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/09/twitter-makes-major-changes-ahead-us-election?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Twitter Goes Into Low-Power Mode
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Twitter Follows computer" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjA2L3R3aXR0ZXJfZm9sbG93cy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ahead of Election Day, Twitter announced <a href="https://blog.twitter.com/en_us/topics/company/2020/2020-election-changes.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">major changes</a> to curb the spread of another virus—misinformation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Call it the social media version of a face mask mandate. To slow the rate of virality, Twitter is adding an extra hurdle to retweeting another account's posts. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it works: </strong><strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When you hit "retweet" on someone's post, you'll be given a prompt to add your own take (the "Quote Tweet" option).</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While the company admits this will add "extra friction," the goal is to encourage users to add their own "thoughts, reactions, and perspectives to the conversation." And when you're forced to think about something for longer than a millisecond, you might realize it's bogus. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This change, like most of the others Twitter revealed yesterday, is temporary. Twitter said this Quote Tweet feature will begin on Oct. 20 and extend at least through the end of election week.   </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let's talk about Twitter’s other updates</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They mainly focus on politicians who want to use the platform to undermine election results. Twitter said it would remove tweets that encourage violence or urge people to interfere with the election process, and it would slap a label on tweets by candidates who prematurely claim they won an election before officials blow the final whistle. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What does it all mean? </strong>The updates "could set the social media platform on a collision course” with President Trump, who has repeatedly tried to undermine public confidence in the electoral process, <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/feda2f38-4777-4400-8602-f2bc0a60de42?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the FT writes</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Twitter's not alone in treating the election like a doomsday prepper. This week, Facebook said it would <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/07/technology/facebook-political-ads-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ban</a> political ads after polls close on Election Day and put a banner at the top of your feed letting you know that no winner has been decided until news outlets declare one. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Social media execs know they'll be the first responders to any Election Day breakdown, so they're preparing for every possible scenario. The big question is, will it work?   </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SMALL BIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/09/yelp-flag-businesses-accused-racist-behavior?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What's Worse Than a 1-Star Review?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt='A photo of a Yelp website alert that states "Business Accused of Racist Behavior"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzM4L3llbHBfYWxlcnQucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Yelp</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A giant banner saying your business acted in a racist manner. Earlier this week, Yelp announced it'll <a href="https://www.eater.com/2020/10/8/21508204/yelp-new-feature-will-alert-users-to-businesses-accused-of-racist-behavior?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slap alerts</a> on the pages of businesses accused of racist behavior. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Per Yelp's clarification to Eater, that includes "the use of racist language, symbols, or sentiment that clearly discredits the Black Lives Matter movement."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backdrop: </strong>As interest in BLM skyrocketed this summer, Yelp <a href="https://blog.yelp.com/2020/10/new-consumer-alert-on-yelp-takes-firm-stance-against-racism?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">noticed</a> a growing number of reviews alleging racist behavior. The platform recorded a 133% uptick in incidents spurred by media reports or social media posts compared to last year and has already put 450+ alerts on business pages.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yelp's slapped warning labels on before. Sometimes, businesses get "review bombed" after being featured in controversial news stories or social posts—which Yelp has navigated by warning visitors that reviews may be distorted by people who've never actually been customers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Now, Yelp finds itself in the difficult position of making judgements on what counts as overtly racist behavior.</p>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/09/broadway-extends-shutdown-may-2021?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Broadway's Shutdown Enters Act 3

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="theater closing gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/26DNj3m60LSAXPvos/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Who could've predicted <em>Hamilton </em>on Disney+ would be the only taste of Broadway we'd get for more than a year? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Broadway League <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/broadway-extends-shutdown-through-may-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">extended its shutdown</a> another four months through May 30, 2021. By then, it'll have been 444 days since theaters closed their doors due to the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Broadway's shutdown has major ripple effects for the New York City economy. Not only are performers and theater workers affected, but so are all the restaurants, parking garages, retailers, and more that support the Broadway ecosystem. The League puts Broadway's annual economic impact at $14.8 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>no one knows exactly when curtains will rise again, but one of the most anticipated shows, <em>The Music Man </em>starring Hugh Jackman, has <a href="https://deadline.com/2020/10/hugh-jackman-music-man-broadway-opening-date-rescheduled-coronavirus-shutdown-extension-1234594485/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set opening night</a> for February 10, 2022. When/if that actually happens, we can't imagine how emotional it'll be.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’ve come upon a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/07/important-infogathering-skill-stopping" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">veritable wealth of knowledge</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Once again, we’ve teamed up with our pals at Motley Fool to bring you extended and unmatched <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/07/important-infogathering-skill-stopping" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investing tips, tricks, and know-how</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This morning, <strong style="color:#000">we’re diving into information overload and how to avoid it</strong>. That’s right: Our advice here will have you actually doing <em>less </em>homework and just maybe seeing <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/07/important-infogathering-skill-stopping" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more<em> </em>returns as a result</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But that’s all we’ll tease here.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Check out our succinct article on investing info overload <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/07/important-infogathering-skill-stopping" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">right here</a>.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/09/microsoft-take-hybrid-wfh-approach?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Microsoft Home Office 365
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Home office" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC85MzMvaG9tZV9vZmZpY2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon is now the last member of the FAMGA quintet holding out on a WFH future. Yesterday, The Verge <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/9/21508964/microsoft-remote-work-from-home-covid-19-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> that Microsoft will take a "hybrid" approach and allow more employees to take a client call while folding laundry. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>Most Microsoft employees can choose to WFH up to half their work week, and the company will also allow more employees to work remotely on a permanent basis. If employees make that choice, Microsoft will cover home office expenses and <a href="https://www.engadget.com/microsoft-teams-virtual-commute-141044437.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">provide</a> a "virtual commute" so they don't fall behind on podcasts like <a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Business Casual</em></a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>This summer, as other big tech <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/21/facebook-joins-accelerating-trend-toward-permanent-remote-work?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">companies</a> <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/27/google-extends-remote-policy-july-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">started</a> <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/12/twitter-announces-blanket-work-home-policy-signaling-shift?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">harmonizing</a> on a WFH future, Microsoft boss Satya Nadella was still humming a skeptical tune. In May, he <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/14/business/dealbook/satya-nadella-microsoft.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a> the NYT that fully embracing remote work could adversely impact mental health and feelings of community. But if there's one thing tech companies hate, it's having a competitor outdo your employee perks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Like Facebook, Twitter, VMware, and Slack, Microsoft will <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-05/covid-effect-tech-workers-face-salary-cuts-if-they-relocate-to-cheaper-places?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">adjust employee compensation</a> and benefits if they move to an area with lower costs of living. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/09/chinese-travel-numbers-dip-golden-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vacations Are Not Dead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Crowded train station " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzM5L2Nyb3dkZWRfdHJhaW5fc3RhdGlvbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Zhong Liting/Southern Metropolis Daily</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We checked the timestamp on this photo 100 times—and can confirm it was taken very recently. In fact, this was the scene at the Guangzhou South Railway Station on Thursday, the final day of China's eight-day Golden Week holiday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The holiday was viewed as a major test of people's willingness to travel and spend money during the pandemic. So <a href="https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-travel-hong-kong-consumer-spending-holidays-4f1b930bd8fff5d4c0e0a280d76379cc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">what did we learn</a>? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More than 45% of China's 1.4 billion people traveled during the holiday, spending $69.5 billion, according to the Ministry of Culture and Tourism. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>However, that's a 21% drop-off in trips and a 30% decrease in spending from last year. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With severe restrictions on international travel, the Golden Week numbers show the limits of purely domestic tourism...even with China not reporting a locally transmitted Covid-19 infection since August.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Bonus pic, </strong>because it's been a long week. Here's a Chinese high-speed train passing in front of the Great Wall:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzQwL3RyYWluX2luX2NoaW5hLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Xinhua/Ju Huanzong via Getty Images</em> </small></p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">World Mental Health Day is today:</strong> <a href="https://www.who.int/news-room/events/detail/2020/10/10/default-calendar/the-big-event-for-mental-health?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tune in</a> for the WHO's annual Big Event, see how companies are <a href="https://www.thedrum.com/news/2020/10/09/brands-back-world-mental-health-day-asics-dave-snap-more-unveil-initiatives?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">aligning with</a> the moment, and find resources to enhance your own mental health using <a href="https://www.projecthealthyminds.com/resources?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this guide</a> from <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/project-healthy-minds-a-mental-health-non-profit-launches-with-entertainment-industry-support?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Project Healthy Minds</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Weekend Conversation Starters: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What are this year’s </span><span><a href="https://frightgeist.withgoogle.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most popular</a></span><span> Halloween costumes? </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Rank your top five cringiest clichés, then </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/29/morning-brew-style-blog-no-6-purge-clichs-vocabulary?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">avoid them</a></span><span> like the plague. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What do you make of these </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/CourtneyNoir/status/1313479884833009665?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hot cocoa bombs</a></span><span>? </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Find out what song was No. 1 on your 12th birthday. That's your life's theme song.</span></li>
</ul>
</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today’s Saturday Headlines is guest-curated by Indiana Jones. Three of these recent headlines about ancient life are real; one is pure myth. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Julius Caesar did not eat a </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/3IpHeyAdAmjQI/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">single root vegetable</a></span><span> during his entire life, new study finds”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Chris Hemsworth helps </span><span><a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/chris-hemsworth-helps-reintroduce-tasmanian-devils-to-australia-for-first-time-in-3000-years/#:~:text=Marvel%20actor%20Chris%20Hemsworth%20joined,back%20Tasmanian%20devils%20to%20Australia.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reintroduce</a></span><span> Tasmanian devils to Australia for first time in 3,000 years”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“T. Rex skeleton brings </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/06/arts/design/t-rex-skeleton-brings-31-8-million-at-christies-auction.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$31.8 million</a></span><span> at Christie’s auction”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Archaeologists in Egypt </span><span><a href="https://www.firstpost.com/world/archaeologists-in-egypt-crack-open-2500-year-old-mummy-coffin-video-goes-viral-8889011.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crack open</a></span><span> 2,500-year-old mummy coffin, video goes viral”</span>
</li>
</ol>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOCIAL MEDIA \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/09/twitter-makes-major-changes-ahead-us-election?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTwitter Goes Into Low-Power Mode\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Twitter Follows computer\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjA2L3R3aXR0ZXJfZm9sbG93cy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAhead of Election Day, Twitter announced \u003ca href=\"https://blog.twitter.com/en_us/topics/company/2020/2020-election-changes.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajor changes\u003c/a\u003e to curb the spread of another virus—misinformation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCall it the social media version of a face mask mandate. To slow the rate of virality, Twitter is adding an extra hurdle to retweeting another account's posts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it works: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhen you hit \"retweet\" on someone's post, you'll be given a prompt to add your own take (the \"Quote Tweet\" option).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile the company admits this will add \"extra friction,\" the goal is to encourage users to add their own \"thoughts, reactions, and perspectives to the conversation.\" And when you're forced to think about something for longer than a millisecond, you might realize it's bogus. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis change, like most of the others Twitter revealed yesterday, is temporary. Twitter said this Quote Tweet feature will begin on Oct. 20 and extend at least through the end of election week.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet's talk about Twitter’s other updates\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThey mainly focus on politicians who want to use the platform to undermine election results. Twitter said it would remove tweets that encourage violence or urge people to interfere with the election process, and it would slap a label on tweets by candidates who prematurely claim they won an election before officials blow the final whistle. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat does it all mean? \u003c/strong\u003eThe updates \"could set the social media platform on a collision course” with President Trump, who has repeatedly tried to undermine public confidence in the electoral process, \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/feda2f38-4777-4400-8602-f2bc0a60de42?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe FT writes\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwitter's not alone in treating the election like a doomsday prepper. This week, Facebook said it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/07/technology/facebook-political-ads-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eban\u003c/a\u003e political ads after polls close on Election Day and put a banner at the top of your feed letting you know that no winner has been decided until news outlets declare one. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSocial media execs know they'll be the first responders to any Election Day breakdown, so they're preparing for every possible scenario. The big question is, will it work?   \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA giant banner saying your business acted in a racist manner. Earlier this week, Yelp announced it'll \u003ca href=\"https://www.eater.com/2020/10/8/21508204/yelp-new-feature-will-alert-users-to-businesses-accused-of-racist-behavior?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslap alerts\u003c/a\u003e on the pages of businesses accused of racist behavior. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePer Yelp's clarification to Eater, that includes \"the use of racist language, symbols, or sentiment that clearly discredits the Black Lives Matter movement.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backdrop: \u003c/strong\u003eAs interest in BLM skyrocketed this summer, Yelp \u003ca href=\"https://blog.yelp.com/2020/10/new-consumer-alert-on-yelp-takes-firm-stance-against-racism?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enoticed\u003c/a\u003e a growing number of reviews alleging racist behavior. The platform recorded a 133% uptick in incidents spurred by media reports or social media posts compared to last year and has already put 450+ alerts on business pages.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYelp's slapped warning labels on before. Sometimes, businesses get \"review bombed\" after being featured in controversial news stories or social posts—which Yelp has navigated by warning visitors that reviews may be distorted by people who've never actually been customers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Now, style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWho could've predicted \u003cem\u003eHamilton \u003c/em\u003eon Disney+ would be the only taste of Broadway we'd get for more than a year? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Broadway League \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/broadway-extends-shutdown-through-may-2021?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eextended its shutdown\u003c/a\u003e another four months through May 30, 2021. By then, it'll have been 444 days since theaters closed their doors due to the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eBroadway's shutdown has major ripple effects for the New York City economy. Not only are performers and theater workers affected, but so are all the restaurants, parking garages, retailers, and more that support the Broadway ecosystem. The League puts Broadway's annual economic impact at $14.8 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eno one knows exactly when curtains will rise again, but one of the most anticipated shows, \u003cem\u003eThe Music Man \u003c/em\u003estarring Hugh Jackman, has \u003ca href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/10/hugh-jackman-music-man-broadway-opening-date-rescheduled-coronavirus-shutdown-extension-1234594485/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset opening night\u003c/a\u003e for February 10, 2022. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmazon is now the last member of the FAMGA quintet holding out on a WFH future. Yesterday, The Verge \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/10/9/21508964/microsoft-remote-work-from-home-covid-19-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e that Microsoft will take a \"hybrid\" approach and allow more employees to take a client call while folding laundry. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eMost Microsoft employees can choose to WFH up to half their work week, and the company will also allow more employees to work remotely on a permanent basis. If employees make that choice, Microsoft will cover home office expenses and \u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/microsoft-teams-virtual-commute-141044437.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprovide\u003c/a\u003e a \"virtual commute\" so they don't fall behind on podcasts like \u003ca href=\"https://www.businesscasual.fm/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eBusiness Casual\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eThis summer, as other big tech \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/21/facebook-joins-accelerating-trend-toward-permanent-remote-work?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecompanies\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/27/google-extends-remote-policy-july-2021?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estarted\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/12/twitter-announces-blanket-work-home-policy-signaling-shift?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eharmonizing\u003c/a\u003e on a WFH future, Microsoft boss Satya Nadella was still humming a skeptical tune. In May, he \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/14/business/dealbook/satya-nadella-microsoft.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold\u003c/a\u003e the NYT that fully embracing remote work could adversely impact mental health and feelings of community. But if there's one thing tech companies hate, it's having a competitor outdo your employee perks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eLike Facebook, Twitter, VMware, and Slack, Microsoft will \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-05/covid-effect-tech-workers-face-salary-cuts-if-they-relocate-to-cheaper-places?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadjust employee compensation\u003c/a\u003e and benefits if they move to an area with lower costs of living. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe checked the timestamp on this photo 100 times—and can confirm it was taken very recently. In fact, this was the scene at the Guangzhou South Railway Station on Thursday, the final day of China's eight-day Golden Week holiday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe holiday was viewed as a major test of people's willingness to travel and spend money during the pandemic. So \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-travel-hong-kong-consumer-spending-holidays-4f1b930bd8fff5d4c0e0a280d76379cc?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewhat did we learn\u003c/a\u003e? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore than 45% of China's 1.4 billion people traveled during the holiday, spending $69.5 billion, according to the Ministry of Culture and Tourism. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHowever, that's a 21% drop-off in trips and a 30% decrease in spending from last year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWith severe restrictions on international travel, the Golden Week numbers show the limits of purely domestic tourism...even with China not reporting a locally transmitted Covid-19 infection since August.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Bonus pic, \u003c/strong\u003ebecause it's been a long week.
